The movie starring Arundhati Devi, Asit Baran, Ajiy Banerjee and Shobha Sen won the National Award too.

Apna Haath Jagannath is a 1960 drama starring Kishore Kumar, Sayeeda Khan and Nasir Hussain. After finishing college Madan struggles to get a well paying job. Much to the dismay of his family and his future in-laws he takes up a menial job doing laundry. After his father throws him out of the house Madan leaves for Mumbai. His fiance who promised to accompany him doesn't show up due to her father. The film is about Madan's struggles and journey to become a successful businessman.

Chupi Chupi Ashey is a 1960 Bengali murder mystery film starring Chhabi Biswas,  Jahar Ganguly,  Rabin Majumdar and Tapati Debi. Prabir and Kanika begin a hotel and advertise their business through handbills. At the same time,  a woman is murdered in Kolkata and the handbills are left behind by the murderer. A detective is sent to the hotel to find the culprit. The guests of the hotel have a coincidental connection. A second victim is found in the hotel and the mystery is solved by the detective.

Personal Assistant is a 1959 Bengali romance drama film starring Bhanu Bandyopadhyay, Ruma Guha Thakurta, Nripati Chatterjee. Ramapada is searching for an entry-level job and is hired. He plays the piano well and is then hired as a piano player where a comedy of errors occurs at a function one evening.

Dil Deke Dekho is a 1959 Indian Hindi romantic comedy film starring Asha Parekh and Shammi Kapoor. A young heiress Neeta has three suitors. She decides to settle for Raja but soon finds out that he is not who he claims to be. In his effort to defend himself Raja must prove his true identity. But how? Even his mother denies that he is his alias Roop. What will Raja/Roop do to prove his identity to the lady he loves?

Purush is a 1994 Hindi drama, starring Ashwini Bhave and Om Puri. It is the story of a woman bravely putting up a fight against a politician. There is a dark secret to this conflict because the politician had raped her in the past. The film chronicles how she takes him and the system on.

Subah Ka Tara is a 1954 romantic movie starring Pradeep Kumar, Jayshree, Amirbai Karnataki and others. Mohan falls in love with Padmini who has been treated badly by her aunt who she lives with. Mohan is troubled to know of her situation. Mohan meets her aunt because she has chosen a suitor for his cousin sister. When Mohan meets Padmini and tells her of his feelings, she throws Padmini out on the streets. Padmini finally immolates herself and Mohan, knowing of this, turns insane.

Daag is a 1952  Hindi drama film featuring Dilip Kumar, Nimmi and Usha Kiran in lead roles. Dilip Kumar won the first ever Filmfare Award in the Best Actor category for his performance in this film. Shankar lives a poor lifestyle with his widowed mother. To earn a living, he sells toys but is addicted to alcohol. He is in love with Parvati, whose family is against her getting married to Shankar.

Manoos is a 1939 Marathi drama starring Shahu Modak, Shanta Hublikar, Sundara Bai, Ram Marathe and others. 
An honest policeman, Ganpat meets a prostitute, Maina. He saves her when there is a police raid on sex-workers and falls in love with her. He tries to rehabilitate her by marrying her and even takes her to meet his mother and get her approval. But Maina is turned down by society. A dejected Ganpat resorts to drinking. Maina turns bitter. She kills her evil uncle and refuses Ganpat's help when arrested.

Agnikankan is 1932 Marathi bilingual action film starring Shankarrao Bhosle, Kamaladevi and Master Vinayak. The film was directed by V. Shantaram, one of the finest directors of Indian cinema.

Agnikankan revolves around the King of Vaijayanti who is killed by his own commander, Naagraya. However, Queen Veermati manages to escape with her infant son, Prince Sudhirchandra, while Naagraya takes control over the kingdom. Years later, when the prince grows up, he sets out to reclaim his throne.

Ramya Chaitra Kala is a 2009 Kannada romance starring Sandeep and Nandita. It's a story about an innocent man Chenna who believes in helping others. He falls for Shobha. But hell breaks loose on him when Shobha loses her memory.

Bai Mothi Bhagyachi is a 1968 Marathi drama starring  Madhu Apte, Master Bhagwan and Saroj Borkar. Orphaned at the age of 8, abused by her maternal uncle' wife, Bharti is nevertheless told that her astrological chart foretells good things. The opposite happens when she refuses to marry Parshram, who vindictively breaks up her marriage ceremony with mentally challenged Sudhir. Bharti relocates to live in Bombay where she ends up in a brothel.
Gaaer Chele is a Bengali romantic film starring Bidip Lahiri, Chumki Chowdhury, Ramaprasad Banik, Tapati Bhattacharya, Dola Sen, Bhola Tamang and Dhiru Banerje.

Daha Wajta is a 1942 Marathi romantic drama featuring Baby Shakuntala,  Gokhale,  Kishan,  Shankar Kulkarni and others. It is a love story of a rich girl and a poor boy. Both meet at ten o'clock every night. But her wealthy father does not suppport this match.
